SENT.plain: A 39-year-old white man presented with intractable headaches and papilledema

The initial workup, with normal MRI and MRV but elevated cerebrospinal fluid protein raised concerns about the putative diagnosis of idiopathic intracranial hypertension, and his condition remained refractory to maximum medical treatment
Angiography revealed cerebral venous sinus stenosis, thought to represent chronic thrombosis
The diagnosis and treatment of cerebral venous sinus stenosis and thrombosis are discussed
